text.p: Spain's undertakers drove hundreds of hearses into Madrid on Thursday to press demands for liberalisation of their business.

"Article 139 of the constitution mentions the free circulation of people and goods through the national territory, but it seems municipalities have not read that," protested the president of the Association of Spanish Funeral Services, Carlos Rodriguez Ballesteros.

"You get somewhere to do a job because the family has called you there and then it turns out the town hall won't let you perform the service because only their own undertakers can do it, or whatever monopoly they have set up."
Undertakers hoped up to 2,000 hearses would clog up traffic in Madrid and threatened to stage full-blown burial strikes if their demands were not met.
"Let's hope it doesn't get to that," Rodriguez Ballesteros told a radio interviewer.
